result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 4:03 PM Defendant Mark A. Rose appeared by video.  Attorney John C. Lillie III appeared by video for Mark A. Rose.  Attorney Jeri Marsolek in Jackson County  in court for State of Wisconsin.   Attorney to call JA for next date.

2:51 PM Defendant Mark A. Rose appeared by video.  Attorney Melissa S. Inlow appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney John C. Lillie III appeared by video for Mark A. Rose. Defendant waives his in person appearance and has no objection to appearing remotely. Waived reading of Information The Defendant Entered a plea of not guilty.

Initial appearance on June 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

8:57 AM Prosecuting attorney Ellen Anderson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anna M. Rose appeared by video.  Attorney John C. Lillie III appeared by video for Anna M. Rose.  All through Zoom.  Defendant waives her in person appearance and has no objection to appearing remotely.  Defense has not gotten discovery yet and wishes to continue the arraignment.  State has made the request to the Sheriff's Dept.  No information has been filed, sent today.
Arraignment scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Mark A. Rose
Current: 419 W Business County Road A, Dorchester, WI 54425 United States  (Effective: 04-28-2022)
Prior: 419 W. Business A, Dorchester, WI 54425

The defendant shall have no contact with M.S., Seubert, Inc. or employees of Seubert, Inc.  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.

10:55 AM Attorney Melissa S. Inlow appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Mark A. Rose, appeared with Attorney John C. Lillie. All by video, through Zoom.    Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Waived reading of the complaint  Defendant waives his in person appearance and has no objection to appearing remotely.    Preliminary hearing waived.    The Court finds that the defendant has waived his right to a preliminary hearing, intelligently, knowingly and of his own free will and accepts the waiver, finds probable cause and binds the case over for further proceedings.  Arraignment scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
